meanings.definition: A hybrid berry, a cross between a raspberry and a blackberry.
meanings.sent1: I picked a loganberry from the bush in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The loganberry jam tasted delicious on my toast.
meanings.sent3: Why did the loganberry go to school? To become a smart berry!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as a loganberry on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The loganberry's vibrant color stood out among the other fruits.

meanings.definition: The dark red, elongated fruit of the loganberry plant.
meanings.sent1: The loganberry was ripe and ready to be eaten.
meanings.sent2: She savored the juicy loganberry in her fruit salad.
meanings.sent3: Why did the loganberry refuse to play hide and seek? It didn't want to get berry lost!
meanings.sent4: The loganberry dangled temptingly from the vine, like a precious jewel.
meanings.sent5: The loganberry's tangy flavor burst in my mouth with each bite.
